article:
Many students often complain about the school. They might feel they have too much work to do sometimes, or think the rules are too strict. We must learn how to change these "problems" into "challenges". _ is an important part of our development. As young adults, _ is our duty  to try our best to deal with each challenge in our education _ the help of our teacher.
By comparing yourself to other people, you will find your problems are not so terrible. Think about Stephen Hawking, for example, a very clever scientist _ regards his many physical  problems as unimportant. He can't walk or even speak _ he has become very famous and successful. We are probably quite healthy and smart. Let's not worry about our problems. Let's face the challenges Instead .
